A 'continent' is one of several very large landmasses on Earth. They are
generally identified by convention rather than any strict criteria, with seven
regions commonly regarded as continentsâthey are (from largest in size to
smallest): Asia, Africa, North America, South America, Antarctica, Europe, and
Australia. "Most people recognize seven continentsâAsia,
Africa, North America, South America, Antarctica, Europe, and Australia, from
largest to smallestâalthough sometimes Europe and Asia are considered a single
continent, Eurasia."

Plate tectonics is the geological process and study of the movement, collision
and division of continents, earlier known as continental drift.
